<p><strong>Efficient Solution:</strong></p>

y="0"></use></g><use xlink:href="#E16-MJMAIN-29" x="13343" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E16-MJMAIN-3C" x="14011" y="0"></use></g></svg>10<sup>16</sup>. This is because the product of all primes up to 43 is already greater than 10<sup>16</sup>, and for each prime up to 43 we know that there is at least one element in [A, A+43] divisible by that prime implying that the lcm is divisible by that prime as well.</p>
<p>Further, note that for any A, <svg width="40.05ex" height="2.887ex" viewBox="0 -869.3 17243.7 1243" role="img" focusable="false" style="vertical-align: -0.868ex;" aria-hidden="true"><defs><path 52T339 48T401 46H427V0H416Q395 3 257 3Q121 3 100 0H88V46H114Q136 46 152 46T177 47T193 50T201 52T207 57T213 61V578Z"></path><path stroke-width="1" id="E19-MJMAIN-29" d="M60 749L64 750Q69 750 74 750H86L114 726Q208 641 251 514T294 250Q294 182 284 119T261 12T224 -76T186 -143T145 -194T113 -227T90 -246Q87 -249 86 -250H74Q66 -250 63 -250T58 -247T55 -238Q56 -237 66 -225Q221 -64 221 250T66 725Q56 737 55 738Q55 746 60 749Z"></path><path stroke-width="1" id="E19-MJMAIN-2265" d="M83 616Q83 624 89 630T99 636Q107 636 253 568T543 431T687 361Q694 356 694 346T687 331Q685 329 395 192L107 56H101Q83 58 83 76Q83 77 83 79Q82 86 98 95Q117 105 248 167Q326 204 378 228L626 346L360 472Q291 505 200 548Q112 589 98 597T83 616ZM84 -118Q84 -108 99 -98H678Q694 -104 694 -118Q694 -130 679 -138H98Q84 -131 84 -118Z"></path></defs><g stroke="currentColor" fill="currentColor" stroke-width="0" transform="matrix(1 0 0 -1 0 0)"><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMATHI-6C" x="0" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMATHI-63" x="298" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMATHI-6D" x="732" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-28" x="1610" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMATHI-42" x="2000" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-2212" x="2981" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-32" x="3982" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-2C" x="4482" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMATHI-42" x="4928" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-2212" x="5909" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-31" x="6910" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-2C" x="7411" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMATHI-42" x="7856" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-29" x="8615" y="0"></use><use xlink:href="#E19-MJMAIN-2265" x="9283" y="0"></use></g></svg>10<sup>16</sup>. So for all segments with lengths 3, the right endpoint must be smaller than 310<sup>5</sup>, and for each such endpoint, we only need to go through a handful of segments with that endpoint. Thus, we have the following solution:</p>
<ol>
	<li><p>Iterate through the right endpoints r from 2 to 3*10<sup>5</sup>. For each such number, start iterating through the left endpoints l backward from r1 until lcm(l,...r1,r) exceeds 10<sup>16</sup> (be careful of overflows).</p></li>
	<li><p>Maintain a global map, counting for each lcm its frequency. This is the map that we will update as we iterate through the segments as explained above. Now, once we are done with a particular endpoint r, we can answer each query with bounds equal to r there.</p></li>
	<li><p>We are now left to answer queries with r&gt;3*10<sup>5</sup>. Clearly, the answer for such a query is the value stored in the map after we are done iterating, along with possibly some number of segments of length 2 with that lcm. Thus, we now only need to find out for which a, is lcm(a, a+1)=x. As lcm(a, a+1)=a*(a+1), we only need to solve a quadratic equation to find the value of a. If the value of a is an integer and smaller than r, we can add 1 to the value in the map. Thus, all queries have been answered in sufficient time.</p></li>
</ol>

### Author Solution

<pre><code>
#include &lt;bits/stdc++.h&gt;
#define int long long
#define endl '\n'
using namespace std;
 
typedef long long ll;
typedef long double ld;
#define db(x) cerr &lt;&lt; #x &lt;&lt; ": " &lt;&lt; x &lt;&lt; '\n';
#define read(a) int a; cin &gt;&gt; a;
#define reads(s) string s; cin &gt;&gt; s;
#define readb(a, b) int a, b; cin &gt;&gt; a &gt;&gt; b;
#define readc(a, b, c) int a, b, c; cin &gt;&gt; a &gt;&gt; b &gt;&gt; c;
#define readarr(a, n) int a[(n) + 1] = {}; FOR(i, 1, (n)) {cin &gt;&gt; a[i];}
#define readmat(a, n, m) int a[n + 1][m + 1] = {}; FOR(i, 1, n) {FOR(j, 1, m) cin &gt;&gt; a[i][j];}

#define print(a) cout &lt;&lt; a &lt;&lt; endl;
#define printarr(a, n) FOR (i, 1, n) cout &lt;&lt; a[i] &lt;&lt; " "; cout &lt;&lt; endl;
#define printv(v) for (int i: v) cout &lt;&lt; i &lt;&lt; " "; cout &lt;&lt; endl;
#define printmat(a, n, m) FOR (i, 1, n) {FOR (j, 1, m) cout &lt;&lt; a[i][j] &lt;&lt; " "; cout &lt;&lt; endl;}
#define all(v) v.begin(), v.end()
#define sz(v) (int)(v.size())
#define rz(v, n) v.resize((n) + 1);
#define pb push_back
#define fi first
#define se second
#define vi vector &lt;int&gt;
#define pi pair &lt;int, int&gt;
#define vpi vector &lt;pi&gt;
#define vvi vector &lt;vi&gt;
#define setprec cout &lt;&lt; fixed &lt;&lt; showpoint &lt;&lt; setprecision(20);
#define FOR(i, a, b) for (int i = (a); i &lt;= (b); i++)
#define FORD(i, a, b) for (int i = (a); i &gt;= (b); i--)
const ll inf = 1e16;
const ll mod = 1e9 + 7;
//const ll mod = 998244353;
const ll N = 2e5 + 1;
mt19937 rng(chrono::steady_clock::now().time_since_epoch().count());

int power (int a, int b = mod - 2)
{
    int res = 1;
    while (b &gt; 0) {
        if (b &amp; 1)
            res = res * a % mod;
        a = a * a % mod;
        b &gt;&gt;= 1;
    }
    return res;
}

struct meow {int idx, x, r;};
vector &lt;meow&gt; qee;
map &lt;int, vpi&gt; q;
map &lt;int, int&gt; cnt;
vi ans;
int lim = 3e5;

inline int lcm (int a, int b)
{
    int x = a/__gcd(a, b);
    if (x &gt; (2*inf)/b) return 0; //improve for TL?
    return x*b;
}

int check (int x)
{
    int sqr = sqrt(x);
    FOR (r, max(sqr - 2, lim + 1), sqr + 2) 
        if (r*(r - 1) == x) return r;
    return 0;
}

signed main()
{
    ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false);
    cin.tie(0);
    #ifndef ONLINE_JUDGE
if(fopen("input11.txt","r"))
{
freopen("input11.txt","r",stdin);
freopen("output11.txt","w",stdout);
}
#endif
    read(test);
    ans.resize(test + 1);
    FOR (i, 1, test)
    {
        readb(x, r);
        if (r &lt;= lim) q[r].pb({x, i});
        else qee.pb({i, x, r});
    }
    
    FOR (i, 1, lim)
    {
        int l = i;
        FORD (j, i - 1, 1)
        {
            l = lcm(l, j);
            if (!l) break;
            cnt[l]++;
        }
        
        for (pi j: q[i]) ans[j.se] = cnt[j.fi];
    }
    
    for (auto i: qee)
    {
        ans[i.idx] = cnt[i.x];
        int sol = check(i.x);
        if (sol &amp;&amp; sol &lt;= i.r) ans[i.idx]++;
    }
    
    FOR (i, 1, test) cout &lt;&lt; ans[i] &lt;&lt; endl;
}
</code></pre>

### Tester Solution

<pre><code>
#include &lt;bits/stdc++.h&gt;
#include &lt;ext/pb_ds/assoc_container.hpp&gt; 
#include &lt;ext/pb_ds/tree_policy.hpp&gt; 
using namespace std;
using namespace __gnu_pbds;
#define int long long int
#define ordered_set tree&lt;int, nuint_type,less&lt;int&gt;, rb_tree_tag,tree_order_statistics_node_update&gt; 
mt19937 rng(std::chrono::duration_cast&lt;std::chrono::nanoseconds&gt;(chrono::high_resolution_clock::now().time_since_epoch()).count());
#define mp make_pair
#define pb push_back
#define F first
#define S second
const int N=1000005;
#define M 1000000007
#define BINF 1e16
#define init(arr,val) memset(arr,val,sizeof(arr))
#define MAXN 17500001
#define deb(xx) cout &lt;&lt; #xx &lt;&lt; " " &lt;&lt; xx &lt;&lt; "\n";
const int LG = 22;


void solve() {

    vector&lt;pair&lt;int, int&gt;&gt; v;
    for(int i = 1; i &lt; N; i++) {
        int lcm = i * (i + 1);
        for(int j = i + 2; j &lt; N; j++) {
            int a = __gcd(lcm, j);
            double val = log10(lcm) + log10(j) - log10(a);
            if(val &gt; 16.0) break;
            lcm = (lcm / a) * j;
            v.push_back(make_pair(lcm, j));
        }
    }
    sort(v.begin(), v.end());

    int q;
    cin &gt;&gt; q;
    while(q--) {
        int val, x;
        cin &gt;&gt; val &gt;&gt; x;
        int ans = 0;
        pair&lt;int, int&gt; a = make_pair(val, -1);
        int ind = lower_bound(v.begin(), v.end(), a) - v.begin();
        a = make_pair(val, x + 1);
        int ind1 = lower_bound(v.begin(), v.end(), a) - v.begin();
        ans = ind1 - ind;

        int b = sqrt(val);
        int c = b + 1;
        b = b * (b + 1);
        if(b == val and c &lt;= x) {
            ans = ans + 1;
        }
        cout &lt;&lt; ans &lt;&lt; endl;

    }

}


#undef int 
int main() {
#define int long long int
ios_base::sync_with_stdio(false); 
cin.tie(0); 
cout.tie(0);
#ifndef ONLINE_JUDGE
    freopen("input.txt", "r", stdin);
    freopen("optput.txt", "w", stdout);
#endif


    //int T;
    //cin &gt;&gt; T;
 
    //for(int tc = 1; tc &lt;= T; tc++){
        // cout &lt;&lt; "Case #" &lt;&lt; tc &lt;&lt; ": ";
        solve();
    //}


return 0;  
 
}
